item.title: 07 - Free Speech and Big Tech
item.description: In this episode, I talk about the importance of free speech and how it has been enabled and enhanced by many big tech companies and the platforms/services provided by them. Until of course, recently! I discuss how the major companies who may have once been considered champions of free speech, have now started hindering it.

item.title: 06 - Why So Lengthy
item.description: In this ironically short episode, I comment on why I do not intend to deliberately restrict the lengths of my podcast episodes.

item.title: 05 - News and Comedy
item.description:
In this episode, I do some loud thinking on news, comedians and comedians who do news!
PS: Towards the end, I very confusingly say, "I am not against banning." This is a double negative by accident. I am against banning! It should be obvious from the next statement - "I believe in free speech."

item.title: 04 - Zero Knowledge Communication
item.description: We all have heard about E2E encryption and have soon begun to accept it as a private and secure form of communication. But is it really safe? What is needed in order to make E2E communication even safer? Enter Zero Knowledge Encryption. This podcast attempts to explain zero knowledge encryption in a non-technical and approachable manner.

item.title: 03 - Type 2 Diabetes
item.description:
Type 2 Diabetes is affecting more than a few hundred million people on the planet. What is the cause? What is the cure? In this episode we take a look at the disease in great detail, the many wrong assumptions and myths about it and more importantly - a cure!
Disclaimer: Not to be treated as medical advice.
Trivia: Recorded in a single 2.5 hour take! Please excuse voice, style and accent inconsistencies!

item.title: 02 - Podcasts, Automations etc.
item.description: At the time of recording this episode, I am not being allowed by Google to access my Youtube account. I use this opportunity to comment on what happened. As a bonus, I explain how podcasts work and also offer thoughts on the banes of automation.

item.title: 01 - Whatsapp
item.description: My thoughts on the unfortunately popular Whatsapp...
